NUE.FirstLaunchBody: It looks like this is a new World. To get started, you should first add any additional players you might need via the User Management configuration. From there, you can create Actors for them, as well as any other important personas you need to represent. Maps and other visuals can be set up using Scenes, and handouts, notes, and other information can be stored in Journal Entries.
NUE.FirstLaunchHint: This chat card can be popped out by right-clicking it, or you can pop out the entire chat tab by right-clicking the speech bubble icon at the top. You can do the same thing to popout any of the other sidebar tabs as well.
NUE.FirstLaunchInviteBody: When everything is set up and you're ready to invite your players, you can send them a link to your World from the Invitation Links.
NUE.FirstLaunchKB: Be sure to investigate all of the tabs available in this sidebar, and for more in-depth information, you can review the Gamemaster Tutorial series in our Knowledge Base.
NUE.FirstLaunchTroubleshooting: If the Invitation Links dialog indicates that your connection is closed, you may need to set up port forwarding. You can find instructions on how to do this in our Port Forwarding Guide. If you still need help, you are welcome to join our Discord and make a post in #install-and-connection for invite issues, #troubleshooting for general issues with the software, or #core-how-to to find out how to do something in Foundry VTT.

Compatibility.Hint: You may optionally indicate that this package is compatible only with a range of Foundry Virtual Tabletop software versions. Compatibility can be declared for a specific build version like "13.339" or for a broad generation like "13".
Compatibility.Label: Compatibility

description.hint: A plain text or HTML description that explains the purpose and contents of this package.
description.label: Package Description

id.hint: The identifier must be a unique alphanumeric string with no special characters other than hyphens.
id.label: Package Identifier

name.disabledHint: You cannot change this compendium pack name because it already exists.
name.hint: A unique alphanumeric string with no special characters that identifies the compendium pack.
name.label: Name

system.hint: Actor, Item, or Adventure compendium packs (which contain Actors or Items) must declare which specific game system they are designed for.
system.label: Required System

title.hint: The title is human readable and may contain special characters.
title.label: Package Title

url.hint: A website URL where more details about this package can be discovered.
url.label: Package URL

version.hint: The version field identifies a specific iteration of this package. Supported version schemes allow for strings or numbers separated by periods.
version.label: Package Version

PACKAGE.InstallFailed: Errors were encountered while installing the package. Consult your console log (F12) for details.
PACKAGE.LaunchLocked: You may not launch the World "{id}" because it is locked.
PACKAGE.ModuleCreateErrorAlreadyExists: The Module "{id}" already exists! Choose a different package identifier.
PACKAGE.ModuleCreateHint: You can use this form to create a Module which can be shared across multiple Worlds or packaged for distribution to other users. This form supports a subset of possible package configuration. You will be able to further manage and edit your package after creating it by modifying its JSON manifest file.
PACKAGE.ModuleCreateSuccess: Created new Module "{id}", which is now available to use!
PACKAGE.ModuleEditHint: You can use this form to update properties of your Module manifest data.
PACKAGE.ModuleEditWarning: You are editing package manifest data for an installable module. Changes made to this data have the possibility to break functionality or ability of the module to be further updated. Please proceed with caution.
PACKAGE.UninstallLocked: You may not uninstall the {type} "{id}" because it is locked.
PACKAGE.UpdateAllInProgress: An "update all" workflow is already in progress. You must wait for it to complete before updating other package types.

PERMISSION.ActorCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create new Actors in the World.
PERMISSION.BroadcastAudioHint: Allow users with this role to broadcast audio when using A/V chat integration.
PERMISSION.BroadcastVideoHint: Allow users with this role to broadcast video when using A/V chat integration.
PERMISSION.CardsCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create new Cards documents in the World.
PERMISSION.ConfigureHint: Fine tune the permitted actions which are allowed to Users for each role.
PERMISSION.DrawingCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create Drawings using the drawing tools.
PERMISSION.FilesBrowseHint: Allow users with this role to browse through available files in the File Browser.
PERMISSION.FilesUploadHint: Allow users with this role to upload content to the server using the File Browser.
PERMISSION.Instructions: Configure which User role has permission to perform which action. Note that some actions cannot be disabled for Game Master users. Some changes may not take effect until the game is reloaded.
PERMISSION.ItemCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create new Items in the World.
PERMISSION.JournalCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create new Journal Entries in the Journal sidebar.
PERMISSION.MacroScript: Modify Script Macros and Execute Script Region Behaviors
PERMISSION.MacroScriptHint: Allow users with this role to use JavaScript macros that access the Foundry API and to execute Script Behaviors in Scene Regions.
PERMISSION.ManualRollsHint: Allow users with this role the option to manually input rolls.
PERMISSION.MessageWhisperHint: Allow users with this role to use the /whisper chat command to send private messages.
PERMISSION.NoteCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create Note objects from Journal Entries they own.
PERMISSION.PingCanvasHint: Allow users with this role to bring attention to a point on the canvas with a pinging animation.
PERMISSION.PlaylistCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create new playlists in the World and to control playlists they own.
PERMISSION.QueryUserHint: Allow users with this role to query other users.
PERMISSION.SettingsModifyHint: Allow users with this role to modify game settings and enable or disable modules.
PERMISSION.ShowCursorHint: Display the position of the player's mouse cursor to all other connected users.
PERMISSION.ShowRulerHint: Display measurements with tokens and the Measure Distance tool to other connected users.
PERMISSION.TemplateCreateHint: Allow users with this role to create templates for area-of-effect measurement.
PERMISSION.Title: User Permission Configuration
PERMISSION.TokenConfigureHint: Allow users with this role to configure the settings for Tokens they own.
PERMISSION.TokenCreateHint: Allow users with this role to place Tokens for Actors they own on the game canvas.
PERMISSION.TokenDeleteHint: Allow users with this role to delete Tokens for Actors they own on the game canvas.
PERMISSION.WallDoorsHint: Allow users with this role interact with doors defined on the Walls Layer.
PERMISSION.WarningNoCreate: You do not have sufficient permission to create a {document}.

bottom.hint: The bottom of the elevation range.

elevation.hint: The elevation range of the Region.

visibility.hint: Configure the visibility of the Region.
visibility.label: Visibility

SCENE.BackgroundScaleHint: Use SHIFT+Mousewheel or SHIFT+Up Arrow and SHIFT+Down Arrow to adjust the background image size.
SCENE.CaptureInitialViewPosition: Captured canvas position as initial view in the Scene configuration form.
SCENE.DimensionChangeWarning: You are changing the underlying dimensions of this Scene, if you have already placed objects in this Scene this operation may cause those objects to shift position relative to the background image.
SCENE.DimensionLinked: Scene dimensions are currently linked: changing one will change the other to maintain aspect ratio. Click to unlink.
SCENE.DimensionUnlinked: Scene dimensions are currently unlinked, changing one will not change the other. Click to link.
SCENE.DimensionsHint: The scene dimensions are automatically set to match the background image's dimensions when a background image is first configured.
SCENE.DistortedDimensionsWarning: You have chosen new dimensions that are of a different aspect ratio than the original. Do you wish to automatically reposition placed objects such as Tokens? The result may end up appearing distorted.

src.hint: Configure the background image and dimensions of the scene's primary map.
src.label: Background Image

cycle.hint: When this option is checked, the base ambience values are merged with the darkness ambience values according to darkness level.
cycle.label: Blend Ambience

darknessLevel.hint: Apply an overlay that darkens the Scene and diminishes light sources to simulate nighttime or dimly illuminated conditions.
darknessLevel.label: Darkness Level

darknessLock.hint: When this option is checked, the darkness level can't be changed.
darknessLock.label: Darkness Level Lock

darkness.max.hint: A darkness threshold between 0 and 1. When the Scene darkness level exceeds this threshold Global Illumination is automatically disabled.
darkness.max.label: Global Illumination Threshold

enabled.hint: This Scene contains a global source of light that provides all areas of the Scene with a base level of illumination.
enabled.label: Global Illumination

hue.hint: Choose a hue (color) to blend into the entire scene. To activate the color slider, you must have an intensity greater than 0.
hue.label: Hue

intensity.hint: Adjust how intensely the chosen hue is blended into the scene. A high hue intensity saturates the scene with the color, possibly overwhelming existing colors. A lower hue intensity blends in the chosen color more subtly.
intensity.label: Hue Intensity

luminosity.hint: Control how bright the scene appears. Higher luminosity makes the scene bright like a sunny day, while lower luminosity makes it appear darker and gloomier.
luminosity.label: Luminosity

saturation.hint: Adjust the purity of colors in the scene. Settings above 0 make the colors more saturated (intense and vibrant) while negative settings dull and mute the colors.
saturation.label: Saturation

shadows.hint: Raising this slider causes the shadows and darker elements of the scene to be darker and deeper.
shadows.label: Shadows

explored.hint: A color applied to all areas of the Scene which have been explored but are outside of the current vision area.
explored.label: Fog Explored Color

unexplored.hint: A solid color applied to all unexplored areas of the Scene.
unexplored.label: Fog Unexplored Color

exploration.hint: If this setting is enabled, fog-of-war exploration will be tracked on a per-User basis and stored to the database as the Scene is explored. Otherwise, fog exploration does not occur and instead Tokens are limited to only what they can currently see.
exploration.label: Fog Exploration

overlay.hint: An optional fog of war image to be drawn above unexplored parts of the scene.
overlay.label: Fog of War Image

foreground.hint: An optional foreground image which is drawn above other objects in the Scene.
foreground.label: Foreground Image

foregroundElevation.hint: An elevation in distance units which configures the height of the foreground image and overhead tiles.
foregroundElevation.label: Foreground Elevation

size.hint: The pixel size of a single grid space. Use the Grid Configuration tool to visually adjust this.
size.label: Grid Size

journal.hint: A linked Journal Entry providing notes for the Game Master about this Scene.
journal.label: Journal Entry

journalEntryPage.hint: A specific page from the linked Journal Entry.
journalEntryPage.label: Journal Entry Page

navName.hint: An alternative name for the Scene that is displayed in the Navigation Bar instead of the actual Scene name.
navName.label: Navigation Name

padding.hint: An amount of additional padding around the Scene background image which provides usable canvas space.
padding.label: Padding Percentage

playlist.hint: A Playlist that should automatically begin playing when this Scene is activated.
playlist.label: Scene Playlist

playlistSound.hint: A specific Sound within the Audio Playlist, which should play when this Scene is active.
playlistSound.label: Playlist Sound

tokenVision.hint: Restrict visibility within this Scene to the vision of controlled Tokens. If disabled, the entire Scene is visible.
tokenVision.label: Token Vision

weather.hint: Display an active Weather Effect which is present within this Scene.
weather.label: Weather Effect

SCENE.GenerateThumbNoCanvas: Scene thumbnail cannot be generated with 'Disable Game Canvas' setting active.
SCENE.GenerateThumbUploadDenied: The scene thumbnail could not be generated because the user does not have permission to upload files.
SCENE.GridConfigToolHint: Configure the grid and background image position using the mousewheel and arrow keys, or by manually setting the following fields.
SCENE.GridPositionHint: Use the Arrow Keys to shift the background image offset.
SCENE.GridResizeHint: Use ALT+Mousewheel or ALT+Up Arrow and ALT+Down Arrow to adjust the grid size.
SCENE.GridSizeError: This resize would reduce the grid size under the minimum of 50px. If you would like to reduce to this size, please swap to gridless first and resetup a new grid after resize.
SCENE.InitialViewHint: Set a default camera position that is displayed the first time this Scene is viewed.
SCENE.InvalidDimension: The dimension provided would result in a non-integer value for the other dimension. Please try a different value or unlink the dimensions.

adminPassword.hint: An administrator password is used to protect access to this Setup and Configuration area of Foundry Virtual Tabletop. It is strongly encouraged to set an administrator password for your server.
adminPassword.label: Administrator Password

awsConfig.hint: You may provide an AWS configuration file for S3 integration. The path is absolute or relative to the Config subfolder of user data.
awsConfig.label: AWS Configuration Path

compressSocket.hint: Enable compression of data sent from the server to the client via websocket. This is recommended for network performance.
compressSocket.label: Compress Web Socket Data

compressStatic.hint: Compress files served by the Foundry Virtual Tabletop web server before sending them to the client to reduce the amount of data transferred.
compressStatic.label: Compress Static Files

cssTheme.hint: Choose from several visual themes which configure the appearance of the application setup menu.
cssTheme.label: Setup Theme

dataPath.hint: Configure the location where your user data including worlds, systems and modules are stored.
dataPath.label: User Data Path

deleteNEDB.hint: In version 11, our software moved from an old database technology (NEDB) to a new one (LevelDB). We automatically migrate your old database files into the new format and retain the old NEDB files just in case you need to roll back or diagnose some issue. This safety measure increases the amount of space that Foundry Virtual Tabletop consumes on your hard drive. Enabling this feature will automatically delete NEDB files after they have been migrated. This will become the default behavior in Version 12.
deleteNEDB.label: Delete Migrated NEDB Files

fullscreen.hint: Open the application in a full-screen view, without toolbars or other user-interface elements.
fullscreen.label: Full-Screen Mode

hotReload.hint: Allow Packages to hot reload certain assets,such as CSS, HTML, and Localization files without a full refresh. This setting is only recommended for developers.
hotReload.label: Hot-Reload Package Files

language.hint: You may choose a default language for the application by choosing a module which provides the core translation files for that language.
language.label: Default Language

port.hint: Choose which port Foundry Virtual Tabletop uses for TCP connection traffic and enable or disable Universal Plug and Play (UPnP).
port.label: Port

sslCert.hint: You may run the server using secure socket layer (SSL) encryption by providing paths to certificate and key files. Paths are absolute or relative to the Config subfolder in user data.
sslCert.label: Certificate

telemetry.hint: Allow sharing usage data with us that helps us to improve Foundry Virtual Tabletop. The data collected if this option is enabled is documented in our Privacy Policy and does not contain any personally identifying information and is not shared with any other party. Sharing usage data helps us to answer questions like "which Foundry Virtual Tabletop software versions are most heavily used", "which Game Systems are most played", and "which Module versions are frequently installed". We use insights from this data to help us improve software compatibility, provide better customer support, and share aggregate insights with our community. If this option is disabled, no data will be shared.
telemetry.label: Allow Sharing Usage Data

world.hint: You may choose one of your available worlds to automatically launch when the software is started.
world.label: Default World

Save.label: Save Application Configuration
Save.restart: Foundry Virtual Tabletop application configuration settings have been changed. You must restart your server for the changes to take effect.
Save.warning: Modifying these configuration options will require you to restart your server in order for them to take effect. Do you wish to continue?

Telemetry.request1: If you provide your permission, Foundry Virtual Tabletop will share a small amount of anonymous usage data with the foundryvtt.com website that allows our team to better understand how Foundry VTT is being used and helps us to improve the software.
Telemetry.request2: This prompt will only be displayed once, you can change your preferences regarding sharing usage data at any time in the Application Configuration menu by clicking the icon at the top-right of this screen.

SERVER_SETTINGS.Title: Application Configuration
SERVER_SETTINGS.Warning: These fields customize the behavior of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop application. Changes will require the server to restart.

SETTINGS.AnimLightL: Allow light source animations. Disabling this will improve performance for lower-end machines.
SETTINGS.AnimVisionL: Animate Token vision and light changes during Token movement animations. Disabling this will improve performance for lower-end machines.
SETTINGS.CBubL: Configure whether or not chat bubbles will be displayed above Tokens for in-character and emote type chat messages.
SETTINGS.CBubPL: Configure whether to automatically pan the camera to a speaking token when it displays a chat bubble.
SETTINGS.CombatThemeL: The set of Sounds that will play when Combat begins, when your turn is next, and when it is your turn.
SETTINGS.DefaultSheetsH: Configure which sheets are used by default for all the Document types available in the World
SETTINGS.EditorAutosaveH: The number of seconds between each autosave for any open ProseMirror editor.
SETTINGS.EnableHighlightDocumentMatchesH: Enable content link matches when highlighting text in the ProseMirror editor. When enabled, highlighted text will be checked for matching Documents in the world or in any compendium packs and offered as replacement links.
SETTINGS.FPSMeterL: Display a framerate meter in the bottom-right corner of the screen which reports canvas rendering performance in frames-per-second.
SETTINGS.FontConfigH: Configure additional fonts that will be available for use in this World.
SETTINGS.GridDiagonalsL: Configure how diagonal distance is measured on square and hexagonal grids. The number in parentheses defines the length of diagonals in units of grid spaces under each option.
SETTINGS.LClickReleaseL: When enabled, a left click on empty canvas space will release any currently controlled objects. If disabled, objects are released by selecting an empty space, shift-clicking the object, or pressing the escape key.
SETTINGS.LangL: Change the displayed language for Foundry Virtual Tabletop.
SETTINGS.MaxFPSL: Limit the maximum framerate at which Foundry Virtual Tabletop will render canvas updates. Lowering this value may improve application performance for less powerful hardware.
SETTINGS.MipMapL: Compute mipmaps to antialias sprite textures at lower levels of zoom. This is a client setting as different users may prefer different visual styles.
SETTINGS.NoCanvasL: The game canvas which provides a visual representation of the virtual tabletop can be disabled. This allows for low-end machines to use a subset of software features.
SETTINGS.PerformanceModeL: Choose a performance mode which affects canvas rendering quality and application performance. Lower performance modes will work better for less powerful hardware.
SETTINGS.PermissionReset: Reset User role permission configuration to default values.
SETTINGS.PhotosensitiveModeL: Enabling this mode reduces the prevalence and intensity of flashing, fast-moving, and repetitive animations and effects.

SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Hint: Configure overrides of Prototype Token data for all Actors.
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Label: Configure Prototype Overrides
SETTINGS.PrototypeTokenOverrides.Name: Prototype Token Overrides

Reset.Label: Reset Defaults
Reset.Warning: This action will remove all configured overrides.

AllTypes.Hint: These overrides apply to all Prototype Tokens, regardless of parent Actor type. They can themselves be overridden for each Actor type in the subsequent tabs. A blank selection for a field indicates no override.
AllTypes.Label: [All Types]

SETTINGS.ReloadPromptBody: Some of the changed settings require a reload of the application to take effect. Would you like to reload now?
SETTINGS.ResetInfo: Reset all settings back to default values. Click "Save Changes" to confirm.
SETTINGS.ResolutionScaleL: Scale the resolution of the game canvas according to the browser's detected pixel ratio. For display devices with high pixel density (like retina displays) this will increase the rendered resolution of the canvas at the expense of application performance. Resolution scaling is also impacted by the zoom level of the browser or operating system display settings. In such cases this setting will increase or decrease the effective resolution of the canvas depending on the amount of zoom that is applied. Disabling this setting may improve performance at the expense of visual quality for high pixel density displays.
SETTINGS.ScrollStatusL: Scrolling status text may appear above Tokens or other canvas objects to provide text feedback about changes for that object.
SETTINGS.ShowToolclipsH: Configure whether Toolclips should appear when hovering over tools in the sidebar.
SETTINGS.SoftSL: Enable soft shadows for more beautiful dynamic lighting, or disable it for improved performance on machines with lower-end hardware.
SETTINGS.Title: Game Settings
SETTINGS.TokenAutoRotateL: When enabled, Tokens are automatically rotated in the direction of movement by default. Regardless of this setting, the Lock Rotation setting on individual tokens will still prevent their artwork from being visually rotated.
SETTINGS.TokenDragPreviewL: When enabled, vision and lighting for a Token is previewed in real time during a left-click drag workflow. This is disabled by default because it may promote undesirable meta-gaming behaviors.

chatNotifications.hint: Choose whether notifications of new chat messages appear as full chat cards, or only as a pip on the chat tab.
chatNotifications.label: Chat Notifications

applications.hint: Specify whether you prefer windowed UI applications like character sheets to render using a light theme or a dark theme. Not all sheets support this preference.
applications.label: Applications

interface.hint: Specify whether you prefer user interface elements to render using a light theme or a dark theme.
interface.label: Interface

opacity.hint: The opacity of faded user interface elements when they are not active. Lower values are more transparent.
opacity.label: Inactive Opacity

speed.hint: How quickly interface elements fade in or out when the mouse enters or departs their area. Lower values are faster.
speed.label: Fade Speed

fontScale.hint: Enlarge or reduce the default font size used in the application.
fontScale.label: Font Size

uiScale.hint: Apply a global scaling factor to the overall user interface to make it larger or smaller.
uiScale.label: Interface Scale

MENU.hint: Settings which affect how the Foundry Virtual Tabletop user interface appears or behaves.
MENU.label: Configure Interface
MENU.name: User Interface Configuration

SETTINGS.UniversalKeybindingsL: Match shortcuts by the character you type instead of the physical key position. Improves support for AZERTY, QWERTZ, Kana and other layouts. This is an experimental feature. A reload is required.

SETUP.UpdateAvailable: An update to {channel} version {version} is now available!
SETUP.UpdateChannelHint: You may choose an update channel to control the types of updates you wish to receive for the core Foundry Virtual Tabletop software. If you do not have a specific reason to change this, it is recommended to consume the Stable channel.
SETUP.UpdateCompleteAuto: Update completed successfully. Restarting Foundry VTT application.
SETUP.UpdateCompleteManual: Update completed successfully. Shutting down Foundry Virtual Tabletop server for manual restart.
SETUP.UpdateDevelopmentHint: API Development: Releases for testing the design of new features and API changes to obtain feedback from the developer community.
SETUP.UpdateHint: You may update your Foundry Virtual Tabletop software to a new version by checking for update on your preferred Software Update Channel.

SETUP.UpdateLicenseInvalid: Your Foundry Virtual Tabletop license key is not valid.
SETUP.UpdateNoArchive: No update archive exists to install
SETUP.UpdateNoInternetError: Foundry Virtual Tabletop requires an active internet connection to update.
SETUP.UpdateNotAvailable: No software update is currently available on the requested update channel.
SETUP.UpdatePrototypeHint: Prototype: Releases for previewing the design of experimental features which are not yet fully developed.
SETUP.UpdateStableHint: Stable: Releases that have been carefully tested and are recommended for use in live games.
SETUP.UpdateTestingHint: Feature Testing: Releases for testing the functionality of new features to obtain feedback from the general user community.
SETUP.UpdateWarningWillDisable: This update is a new major version of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop software. Installing this update will require some installed modules which may not yet be compatible to be disabled.
SETUP.UpdateWebsiteSlowWarning: https://foundryvtt.com appears to be under heavy load at this time, we recommend you try again later.

SETUP.WorldCoreMigrationRequired: Launching the World {world} will migrate its data model from an older core software version ({oldVersion}) to the currently installed {newVersion}.
SETUP.WorldDeleteConfirmCode: Type this exact code in the box below to proceed:
SETUP.WorldDeleteConfirmWarning: This will permanently delete your World and its content and cannot be un-done. Are you sure you wish to do this?
SETUP.WorldLaunchFailure: World launch failed: {message}. See the console (F12) for more details.
SETUP.WorldMigrationBackupPrompt: It is not possible to reverse this process. It is recommended to back up your World data before proceeding. You will need a backup in order to restore to the prior version.
SETUP.WorldMigrationDisableModules: Be sure to update your game system and installed modules before migrating your World. As part of this migration to a new software generation all modules and active scenes will be disabled and any playing audio will be stopped. You may re-enable these modules after the migration is complete.
SETUP.WorldMigrationInProcess: Your World data is being migrated to be compatible with {version}. This may take some time. Please remain patient and do not close the software.
SETUP.WorldMigrationSystemUnavailable: The installed version of the {system} ({systemVersion}) game system is not verified as compatible with this software version. Successful migration cannot be guaranteed.
SETUP.WorldSystemMigrationRequired: This World was last launched with an older system version ({oldVersion}) than the currently installed system version {newVersion} and may require a system migration.
SETUP.YouMustInstallASystem: You must install a game System before you can create a new World

TEMPLATE.ConeTypeSettingHint: Choose how the area of effect for cone templates should be defined. This setting has no effect if Grid-based Template Shapes is enabled.
TEMPLATE.GridTemplatesSettingHint: Configure whether the area of effect of templates should be grid-based instead of Euclidean.

light.hint: Are light sources blocked based on their elevation relative to the elevation of this Tile?
light.label: Restricts Light

weather.hint: Are weather effects blocked based on their elevation relative to the elevation of this Tile?
weather.label: Restricts Weather

TILE.SECTIONS.overhead: Additional attributes that apply if the Tile is overhead in the Foreground.
TILE.SECTIONS.position: Adjust the position and dimensions of the Tile.

TILE.ScaleHint: Adjust the scale of the image on the X or Y axis. The image may overflow its bounding box. Negative values will flip the image.
TOKEN.AnchorHint: The default anchor (0.5, 0.5) is the center of the Token image.
TOKEN.AssignWarn: You must select one existing Token to assign as the new prototype configuration.
TOKEN.DeleteCombatantWarning: You are deleting a Token that is in Combat. Its Combatant will be permanently deleted.

appendNumber.hint: Append an auto-incrementing number to the name of unlinked tokens. For example "Goblin 3".
appendNumber.label: Append Incrementing Number

lockRotation.hint: Prevent this Token's rotation angle from being rendered on the Canvas.
lockRotation.label: Lock Artwork Rotation

occludable.radius.hint: When this Token is below a Tile that uses radial occlusion, this value controls the size of the hole that is cut in the Tile to allow the Token to be seen through it.
occludable.radius.label: Occlusion Radius

prependAdjective.hint: Prepend a random adjective to the name of unlinked tokens. For example "Angry Goblin".
prependAdjective.label: Prepend Random Adjective

background.hint: A color applied to the background of the ring.
background.label: Background Color

ring.hint: A color applied to the border of the ring.
ring.label: Ring Color

scale.hint: Adjust the relative size of the subject texture to the ring. Increasing this value will make the subject texture larger compared to the ring. Use lower values to reduce the subject texture size if it appears too dominant.
scale.label: Subject Scale Correction

texture.hint: Explicitly specify a path for the artwork placed over the dynamic token ring. If not provided, the ring subject is the same as the standard token texture.
texture.label: Subject Texture

angle.hint: The angle of the vision cone (default is 360).
angle.label: Vision Angle

attenuation.hint: Adjust the strength of the vision source attenuation (default is 0).
attenuation.label: Attenuation

brightness.hint: Adjust the brightness of this vision source. The greater the brightness, the better the character is able to see in darkness (default is 0).
brightness.label: Vision Brightness

contrast.hint: Adjust the contrast of the background which is in the vision source radius (default is 0).
contrast.label: Contrast

enabled.hint: Allows the token to see illuminated spaces within its line of sight.
enabled.label: Vision Enabled

range.hint: The distance a token can see without any light.
range.label: Vision Range

saturation.hint: Adjust the saturation of the background which is in the vision source radius (default is 0).
saturation.label: Saturation

visionMode.hint: Applies a visual effect to the vision to represent special senses (default is Basic Vision).
visionMode.label: Vision Mode

fit.hint: Adjust how the image is fit to the size of the Token.
fit.label: Image Fit Mode

animation.hint: Choose an animation style for this Token's combat turn marker.
animation.label: Animation

disposition.hint: Tint this Token's combat turn marker according to their disposition.
disposition.label: Disposition Tint

mode.hint: Choose Default to use default Combat settings, Disabled to hide the turn marker, or Custom for a unique turn marker behavior.
mode.label: Mode

src.hint: Choose an image or video file used for this Token's combat turn marker.
src.label: Media Source

FIT_MODES.hint: Choose the fit mode for the Dynamic Rings.
FIT_MODES.label: Dynamic Token Rings Fit Modes
FIT_MODES.subject: Standard

SETTINGS.hint: Choose an available dynamic token ring visualization. Changing it requires a reload.
SETTINGS.label: Dynamic Token Rings

TOKEN.SHAPES.ELLIPSE.label: Ellipse

TOKEN.SHAPES.ELLIPSE_2.label: Ellipse (Variant 2)

avatar.hint: A player avatar is displayed when using built-in audio/video chat or may be displayed by modules.
avatar.label: Player Avatar

character.hint: Select an Actor from the set which you have at least OBSERVER permission over which represents the main character for this User.
character.label: Player Character

color.hint: Player color is used for cursors, rulers, templates, and other elements which differentiate between users.
color.label: Player Color

name.hint: Player names must be configured by the Gamemaster and can be changed in the User Management screen.
name.label: Player Name

pronouns.hint: Pronouns which inform how this player wishes to be referred to in third-person.
pronouns.label: Player Pronouns

USERS.NoGMError: You must have at least one Game Master user within your World.
USERS.UpdateSuccess: Game users updated successfully, returning to the game World.

strength.hint: A multiplier between 0 and 2 that modifies how much the door moves when animating. For example for a swinging door, more strength produces a wider open angle. For a sliding door, more strength causes the door to slide farther.
strength.label: Animation Strength

threshold.attenuation.hint: The distance that perception can penetrate this wall is adaptive relative to the observer's proximity and the activation threshold. Only applies when a threshold is defined.
threshold.attenuation.label: Proximity Threshold Attenuation

WALL.Instructions: Customize how this wall segment restricts movement or senses.
WALL.Title: Wall Configuration

WARNING.TilingSpriteDeprecation: A module or system is using the legacy TilingSprite class which is no longer supported.
